intro: Christella wailele, commonly known as the Hawaiian Christella, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests, and is often found in the undergrowth. Its leaves are oval-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Christella wailele is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution.
